jobTitle: Postdoctoral Appointee: Data-intensive Analysis, Visualization, and Management

companyInfo.Competitors: Oak Ridge National Laboratory, Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory, Fermilab

jobDescription: Position Description  The Mathematics and Computer Science Division at Argonne National Laboratory seeks a postdoctoral appointee in computer science to research scalable analysis, visualization, and data management for large-scale simulations and experiments at Argonne National Laboratory.The successful candidate will work as part of a multidisciplinary research team involving computer and computational scientists, physicists, and mathematicians to couple data analysis into parallel simulations and experiments running on DOE leadership-class supercomputing architectures and facilities.  Position Requirements  Candidates should have a doctoral degree and expertise in one or more of the following areas: Knowledge in data analysis and/or scientific visualization algorithms and/or middleware for analysis and data management workflows.Knowledge in software development for shared and distributed memory parallel computing.Desirable knowledge and skills:Knowledge in C++ programming under Unix/Linux.Expertise in parallel programming, many core processing, message passing, threading, dataflow processing, GPU programming.Expertise to create high-quality software and ability to program with various languages, libraries and tools.Good collaborative skills, including the ability to work well with science teams, other laboratories, and universities and possess self-motivation to solve problems and grow professionally.
